intro: Potentilla caulescens clusiana, commonly known as the Clusian cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in moist, temperate climates. The plant features compound leaves with five leaflets, and it produces small, yellow, five-petaled flowers. It is often found in forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
